intro: Strobilanthes autapomorpha, commonly known as the golden flame plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a vibrant display. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
